item.title: Nikola — The Best Blog Engine Ever!
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
I re­cent­ly found out about Niko­la (through Plan­et Python). It is awe­some, even bet­ter than Hyde. Why? Right af­ter the break.

Read more… (5 paragraphs remaining — a 1 minutes’ read)

item.title: A New Engine… Again (And A Few Other Changes)
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
Up­date 2013-02-07: Now run­ning Niko­la.

Hel­lo there. I have a few an­nounce­ments for you.

First of­f, I changed the blog en­gine. It is now ran by Hy­de, a port of Jekyll to Python (but im­proved).

Sec­ond of­f, all posts from 2009 were archived. If you are crazy and want to read them, see 2009 Ar­chives. They won’t be vis­i­ble on the Blog page.

Third of­f, the URLs of posts were changed a bit, but they are fixed by the serv­er.

Fourth of­f, the Projects page will get a lit­tle makeover soon.

That is al­l.

Read more… (0 paragraphs remaining — a 1 minutes’ read)

item.title: HTML5 Transition
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
Recently, the HTML5 logo was published. As W3C states, [i]t stands strong and true, resilient and universal as the markup you write. [...] And it certainly doesn't use tables for layout. The logo’s site presents you with many information about HTML5, the new possibilities and the new logo. Due to that, I decided to make use of HTML5. Right now, the blog is using the HTML5 semantics and CSS3.

Read more… (0 paragraphs remaining — a 1 minutes’ read)

item.title: Jekyll for Dummies
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
This post is an in­tro­duc­tion to Jekyl­l, an awe­some, sim­ple, blog aware, stat­ic site gen­er­a­tor. It’s a how-­to help­ing you in set­ting up Jekyl­l.

…even though I am cur­rent­ly us­ing Niko­la, and I sug­gest you to do the same.

Read more… (19 paragraphs remaining — a 2 minutes’ read)

item.title: Language change + Kw's Devel Site
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
A gi­ant up­date: The Kw’s De­v­el Site is now dead.

Well, the blog is gonna end with Pol­ish ar­ti­cles. It will be in Eng­lish. The next thing is the Kw’s De­v­el Site, a place for all my de­vel­op­ment stuff. Y­ou can­not vis­it it any­more.
